intro: Polemannia grossulariifolia, commonly known as the snowball vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its pendulous clusters of white, fleshy flowers that resemble snowballs. The plant has heart-shaped, hairy leaves and produces small, oval-shaped fruits that turn red when mature. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive blooms. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to tropical gardens and greenhouses.
